reasoning: X-linked hyper-IgM syndrome (CD40L deficiency) is an extremely rare primary immunodeficiency with estimated incidence <0.1 per 100k births, approximately 2 per million live births. Limited to case series and registry data.
source: Notarangelo LD et al. (2006). Primary immunodeficiencies: 2009 update. J Allergy Clin Immunol. 124(6):1161-78
